artist: RC Edwards & the Awsome Possum Band
name: Keystone

content.text:
"Keystone"
Written and performed by Casey "RC" Edwards
(spoken)
Ladies and gentlemen, I'd like to do you a song from the Great Country Guitar book right now. 

[Intro]
[ch]A[/ch] [ch]E[/ch] [ch]D[/ch] (x4)

(Spoken)
Wild geese and all.

[Verse 1]
[ch]A[/ch]
I used to have me a horse I called Keystone, 
          [ch]E[/ch]
I used to ride him all around
[ch]D[/ch]                                      [ch]A[/ch]
one in awhile on Saturday night me and Keystone would head to town
[ch]A[/ch]
I might drink a case of Coors Light, 
[ch]E[/ch]
Keystone drank the Beast,
[ch]D[/ch]                                      [ch]A[/ch]
used to drink homemade wine but he got tired of all the yeast

[Chorus]
[ch]E[/ch]                     [ch]D[/ch]                    [ch]A[/ch]
Yeah Keystone, he's a beer drinkin' sonofa b***h,
[ch]E[/ch]                       [ch]D[/ch]              [ch]A[/ch]
he used to pass out and wake up in the ditch,
[ch]E[/ch]                     [ch]D[/ch]        [ch]A[/ch]
popular with all the ladies of course,
[ch]E[/ch]               [ch]D[/ch]                  [ch]A[/ch]
not much of a man, but a hell of a horse

[Verse 2]
[ch]A[/ch]                                            [ch]E[/ch]
I remember one time me and the 'stone got to drinkin' in this bar
[ch]D[/ch]                                [ch]A[/ch]
he got the bright idea we should steal us a new car
[ch]A[/ch]                                           [ch]E[/ch]
Well we finally parked that Cavalier in the Thunderbird Lake,
          [ch]D[/ch]                          [ch]A[/ch]
When they blamed it all on me it was more than I could take

[Chorus]
[ch]E[/ch]                     [ch]D[/ch]              [ch]A[/ch]
Yeah Keystone, he's a no-good sonofa b***h,
[ch]E[/ch]                [ch]D[/ch]               [ch]A[/ch]           
Left me high and dry out in the ditch
[ch]E[/ch]              [ch]D[/ch]              [ch]A[/ch]              [ch]E[/ch] 
If I ever find him I'm gonna whip his ass of course,
[ch]E[/ch]             [ch]D[/ch]                      [ch]A[/ch] 
not much of a friend, but a hell ofa horse.

[Instrumental]
[ch]A[/ch] [ch]E[/ch] [ch]D[/ch]

(Spoken over instrumental)
This song is a public service announcement for anyone with 
imaginary friends, or imaginary friends who know real people.  
If you're having any problems like this you can get help out there,
just call 1-888-IMAGINE.

[Verse 3]
[ch]A[/ch]                             [ch]E[/ch]
Well I ain't seen that horse, since i got outta jail
     [ch]D[/ch]                                   [ch]A[/ch]
and if i ever find him its gonna be pure hell
[ch]A[/ch]                            [ch]E[/ch]
only one thing he can do, to be my friend again,
    [ch]D[/ch]                                  [ch]A[/ch]
and it starts with a 30-pack and some mexican gin

[Chorus]
[ch]E[/ch]                     [ch]D[/ch]                    [ch]A[/ch]
Yeah Keystone, he's a beer-drinkin' sonofa b***h,
[ch]E[/ch]                       [ch]D[/ch]              [ch]A[/ch]
he used to pass out and wake up in the ditch,
[ch]E[/ch]                     [ch]D[/ch]        [ch]A[/ch]
popular with all the ladies of course,
[ch]E[/ch]               [ch]D[/ch]                  [ch]A[/ch]
not much of a man, but a hell of a horse
[ch]E[/ch]                  [ch]D[/ch]                    [ch]A[/ch]
Yeah not much of a man, but a hell of a horse.

artist: RC Edwards & the Awsome Possum Band
name: Navaho Beer

content.text:
[INTRO]  
[ch]G[/ch]  [ch]C[/ch]  [ch]D[/ch]  (x2)

[ch]G[/ch]     
I remember one summer me and Daniel Ray, 
     [ch]C[/ch]
were cruisin through New Mexico around Santa Fe,
         [ch]D[/ch]                                            [ch]G[/ch]
When we came across a stand sellin' gallons of Navaho Beer,
[ch]G[/ch]
We was both pretty thirsty so we stopped in,
          [ch]C[/ch]      
bought a gallon a piece and threw caution to the wind
    [ch]D[/ch]                                                 [ch]G[/ch]          
and commenced to drinkin' with a couple of breaks of bread.

[ch]G[/ch]
I noticed Daniel's face start turnin' red,
    [ch]C[/ch]
and two big horns sprouted outta his head,
        [ch]D[/ch]                                    [ch]G[/ch]
and his eyes that was blue faded away to solid black,
[ch]G[/ch]
I looked at the beer and it was all gone, 
    [ch]C[/ch]
and six rattlesnakes was begin'n to spawn,
         [ch]D[/ch]                                                  [ch]G[/ch]
from the crustaceous masses in the bottom of the glasses of beer.

[CHORUS]
[ch]G[/ch]
Well, I've been around and I've seen alot,
        [ch]C[/ch]
but the craziest thing, I've ever got,
   [ch]D[/ch]                              [ch]G[/ch]
my hands on is a bottle of Navaho beer,
[ch]G[/ch]
you can listen to me, or try it for yourself,
     [ch]C[/ch] 
but I'll leave'r sittin', there on the shelf,
     [ch]D[/ch]                                   [ch]G[/ch]
stay clear of that s**t they call Navaho beer.

[ch]G[/ch]
Had Sammy Davis,Jr. ridin' shotgun,
    [ch]C[/ch] 
now ordinarily that would've been fun,
       [ch]D[/ch]                                               [ch]G[/ch]
but he pulled out his eye and he was jammin' it in my ear,
[ch]G[/ch]
I said "look now Sammy I'ma tryin' to drive, 
    [ch]C[/ch]
and anyhow, you ain't supposed to be alive,
    [ch]D[/ch]                                                  [ch]G[/ch]
now where the hell is Daniel and whats in that Navaho beer?"

[ch]G[/ch]
Well a cop pulled us over, i was scared as hell,
        [ch]C[/ch]
I said "Dammit Sammy, we's a goin' to jail"
      [ch]D[/ch]                                       [ch]G[/ch]
and I slowly began to roll my winder down,
[ch]G[/ch]
I said "howdy officer can we just talk?"
         [ch]C[/ch]
he said "hell no son, you're on the sidewalk,
     [ch]D[/ch]  
and, we don't drive like that in my town"

[ch]G[/ch]
Well I stepped out the car, didn't put up a fight,
    [ch]C[/ch]
now Mr. Bojangles he wasn't so polite,
      [ch]D[/ch]                                          [ch]G[/ch]
and I think he was makin' a move for one of his guns,
[ch]G[/ch]
I said "Oh my God!" and I grabbed his hand,
        [ch]C[/ch]
but you know them cops never understand,
         [ch]D[/ch]                                    [ch]G[/ch]
and they fired five rounds for the thing was done.

[ch]G[/ch]
Well the shots they shot, they didn't hit me,
       [ch]C[/ch]
Didn't hit Sammy Davis or my pickup seat 
    [ch]D[/ch]                                       [ch]G[/ch]
but one of them boys was screamin' "Officer Down!"
[ch]G[/ch]
Well, one of them shots had hit him in the leg,
           [ch]C[/ch]
and it was all his fault is what Sammy said,
 [ch]D[/ch]                                      [ch]G[/ch]
Next thing I know we was speedin' outta town.

[CHORUS]
[ch]G[/ch]
Woke up the next day in South Padre,
    [ch]C[/ch]
and right there next to me was Daniel Ray,
    [ch]D[/ch]                           [ch]G[/ch]
and we was both sleepin' on the beach,
[ch]G[/ch]
We drove that truck off in the ocean,
    [ch]C[/ch]    
and hitchiked back to Oklahoma,
    [ch]D[/ch]                                           [ch]G[/ch]
and swore off drinkin' for seven days shy of a week.

[CHORUS]
[ch]G[/ch]
Yodalady, yodalady, yodalady who,
    [ch]C[/ch]
yodalady, yodalady, yodalay
    [ch]D[/ch]                      [ch]G[/ch]
yodalady, yodalady, Navaho Beer.

name: Gimme An Rc Cola And A Moon Pie
tuning: E A D G B E

content.text:
Gimme An RC Cola and a Moon Pie - Big Bill Lister


[Verse 1]
           [ch]F[/ch]

          [ch]C[/ch]            [ch]F[/ch]
And play "Maple on the Hill"
     [ch]F[/ch]
I'll catch that freight train on the blind
         [ch]G[/ch]                [ch]C[/ch]
Leave my corn down at the mill
        [ch]F[/ch]
Cause I sold my calf
      [ch]F[/ch]
For a dollar and a half
   [ch]Bb[/ch]                    [ch]F[/ch]
So brother I can pay the bill

Give me an RC Cola and a Moon Pie
          [ch]C[/ch]            [ch]F[/ch]
And play "Maple on the Hill"

[Verse 2]

Ridin' saplings all day long
[ch]F[/ch]
Clearing Pap's new ground

But I'll be leaving before long
[ch]G[/ch]          [ch]C[/ch]
Goin' into town.
  [ch]F[/ch]
I may be just a country boy,
    [ch]Bb[/ch]               [ch]F[/ch]

With an RC Cola and a Moon Pie

And playin' "Maple on the Hill"

Got a brand new pair of overalls
[ch]F[/ch]
Grosgrains greased and shined

I'll tell you boys, I did it all
[ch]G[/ch]               [ch]C[/ch]
For that gal of mine.

We'll dance all night til' broad daylight
     [ch]Bb[/ch]            [ch]F[/ch]
Will find us goin' still,
           [ch]F[/ch]
With an an RC Cola and a Moon Pie
             [ch]C[/ch]            [ch]F[/ch]
And playin' "Maple on the Hill."

[Verse 4]

Give me an RC Cola and a Moon Pie
          [ch]C[/ch]            [ch]F[/ch]
And play "Maple on the Hill"
     [ch]F[/ch]
I'll catch that freight train on the blind
         [ch]G[/ch]                [ch]C[/ch]
Leave my corn down at the mill
        [ch]F[/ch]
Cause I sold my calf
     [ch]F[/ch]
For a dollar and a half
   [ch]Bb[/ch]                    [ch]F[/ch]
So brother I can pay the bill
           [ch]F[/ch]
Give me an RC Cola and a Moon Pie
         [ch]C[/ch]             [ch]F[/ch]
And play "Maple on the Hill"

[Outro]
          [ch]F[/ch]
Give me an RC Cola and a Moon Pie
          [ch]C[/ch]            [ch]F[/ch]
And play "Maple on the Hill"

tuning: E A D G B E

content.text:
Cryin’ My Blues Away


(Intro)
D# --- F --- A# --- D# --- A# ---


[ch]D#[/ch] 
I sit around and twiddle my thumbs
[ch]F[/ch]
make not a sound and nobody comes
        [ch]A#[/ch]
with my head hanging low
                    [ch]D#[/ch]   [ch]A#[/ch]
I’m crying my blues away.


[ch]D#[/ch]
Hoping you'll come for I love you still
[ch]F[/ch]
I don’t know why but I always will
      [ch]A#[/ch]
And I want you to know
                    [ch]D#[/ch]   [ch]A#[/ch]
I’m cryin’ my blues away.


(Chorus)


[ch]D#[/ch]                              
Everyday thoughts of you
          [ch]C[/ch]         [ch]C7[/ch]                                  
Keep me sobbing (sobbing)


[ch]F[/ch]                              [ch]F7[/ch]         [ch]A#[/ch]
And my poor heart keeps on throbbing (throbbing)


[ch]D#[/ch]
Crying for you, no one dear but you
[ch]F[/ch]
Seems like there’s nothing else I can do
        [ch]A#[/ch]
With my head hanging low
                    [ch]D#[/ch] 
I’m cryin’ my blues away.

[ch]C[/ch]                  [ch]Am[/ch]

name: Dont Drive Me Away
tuning: E A D G B E

content.text:
This is a simplified version, suitable for strumming, of "Don't Drive Me Away" as performed by R C Smith
(aka Robert Curtis Smith) - see https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Vy1ueGSZipY
This version is in the original key of E, played with no capo.
Play with a swing feel. The E, A and B/A chords start on beat 1 of each bar while the 7th chords start on the
"and" of beat 2. On the record the song fades out over the last line of the final chorus. You could just
repeat the last line a few times before stopping.
A later version of the song was released by Sam Cooke under the name "Please Don't Drive Me Away".

[Chords]
[ch]E[/ch]    : 022100
[ch]E7[/ch]   : 022130
[ch]A[/ch]    : x02225
[ch]A7[/ch]   : x02223
[ch]B/A[/ch]  : x04447
[ch]B7/A[/ch] : x04445

[Intro]
[ch]E[/ch]       [ch]E7[/ch]      [ch]E[/ch]       [ch]E7[/ch]
[ch]E[/ch]       [ch]E7[/ch]      [ch]E[/ch]       [ch]E7[/ch]
[ch]A[/ch]       [ch]A7[/ch]      [ch]A[/ch]       [ch]A7[/ch]
[ch]E[/ch]       [ch]E7[/ch]      [ch]E[/ch]       [ch]E7[/ch]
[ch]B/A[/ch]     [ch]B7/A[/ch]    [ch]A[/ch]       [ch]A7[/ch]
[ch]E[/ch]       [ch]E7[/ch]      [ch]E[/ch]       [ch]E7[/ch]

[Verse 1]
[ch]E[/ch]           [ch]E7[/ch]               [ch]E[/ch]     [ch]E7[/ch]
 I love you baby, I want you by my side
[ch]E[/ch]            [ch]E7[/ch]           [ch]E[/ch]     [ch]E7[/ch]
 My love for you, I could never hide

[Chorus]
[ch]A[/ch]       [ch]A7[/ch]       [ch]A[/ch]        [ch]A7[/ch]
 If you love me, hear my plea
[ch]E[/ch]             [ch]E7[/ch]  [ch]E[/ch]       [ch]E7[/ch]
 Don't put me out, in the street
       [ch]B/A[/ch]   [ch]B7/A[/ch]   [ch]A[/ch]        [ch]A7[/ch]         [ch]E[/ch]     [ch]E7[/ch]    [ch]E[/ch]    [ch]E7[/ch]
I said ple - ase,      don't drive me a-way
       [ch]B/A[/ch]   [ch]B7/A[/ch]   [ch]A[/ch]        [ch]A7[/ch]         [ch]E[/ch]     [ch]E7[/ch]    [ch]E[/ch]    [ch]E7[/ch]
I said ple - ase,      don't drive me a-way

[Verse 2]
[ch]E[/ch]           [ch]E7[/ch]          [ch]E[/ch]         [ch]E7[/ch]
 I love you baby, won't do you no wrong
[ch]E[/ch]        [ch]E7[/ch]         [ch]E[/ch]        [ch]E7[/ch]
 Come on back here, let's go home

[Chorus]
[ch]A[/ch]       [ch]A7[/ch]       [ch]A[/ch]        [ch]A7[/ch]
 If you love me, hear my plea
[ch]E[/ch]             [ch]E7[/ch]  [ch]E[/ch]       [ch]E7[/ch]
 Don't put me out, in the street
       [ch]B/A[/ch]   [ch]B7/A[/ch]   [ch]A[/ch]        [ch]A7[/ch]         [ch]E[/ch]     [ch]E7[/ch]    [ch]E[/ch]    [ch]E7[/ch]
I said ple - ase,      don't drive me a-way
       [ch]B/A[/ch]   [ch]B7/A[/ch]   [ch]A[/ch]        [ch]A7[/ch]         [ch]E[/ch]     [ch]E7[/ch]    [ch]E[/ch]    [ch]E7[/ch]
I said ple - ase,      don't drive me a-way

[Verse 3]
[ch]E[/ch]           [ch]E7[/ch]              [ch]E[/ch]    [ch]E7[/ch]
 I love you baby, you don't even care
[ch]E[/ch]          [ch]E7[/ch]        [ch]E[/ch]         [ch]E7[/ch]
 Come back here, and answer my prayer

[Chorus]
[ch]A[/ch]       [ch]A7[/ch]       [ch]A[/ch]        [ch]A7[/ch]
 If you love me, hear my plea
[ch]E[/ch]             [ch]E7[/ch]  [ch]E[/ch]       [ch]E7[/ch]
 Don't put me out, in the street
       [ch]B/A[/ch]   [ch]B7/A[/ch]   [ch]A[/ch]        [ch]A7[/ch]         [ch]E[/ch]     [ch]E7[/ch]    [ch]E[/ch]    [ch]E7[/ch]
I said ple - ase,      don't drive me a-way
       [ch]B/A[/ch]   [ch]B7/A[/ch]   [ch]A[/ch]        [ch]A7[/ch]         [ch]E[/ch]     [ch]E7[/ch]    [ch]E[/ch]    [ch]E7[/ch]
I said ple - ase,      don't drive me a-way

Capo 1

[Chorus]
[ch]C[/ch]                   [ch]Am[/ch]
  If I got locked away
                        [ch]F[/ch]
  And we lost it all today
                     [ch]C[/ch]               
  Tell me honestly, would you 
         [ch]G[/ch]    [ch]G6[/ch]  [ch]G[/ch]    [ch]C[/ch]
  still love me the same?
                       [ch]Am[/ch]
  If I showed you my flaws
                      [ch]F[/ch]
  If I couldn't be strong
                     [ch]C[/ch]
  Tell me honestly, would you 
         [ch]G[/ch]    [ch]G6[/ch]  [ch]G[/ch]    [ch]C[/ch] 
  still love me the same?
N.C.
  Right about now

[Verse 1]
N.C.
  Uh, I'm going away for a while
N.C.
  Pray for me child, would you wait for me now?
N.C.
  I know sometimes confusion can get weighed to the doubt
N.C.
  And sometimes I fall short of what I say I'm about, but
[ch]Am[/ch]
  At my best I am love
N.C.
  And nothing comes easy but in God we trust
N.C.
  And she ride for me and I ride for us
